intro: Paepalanthus capillaris, commonly known as the silky grass of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown, and it thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its fibrous roots and dense foliage make it well adapted to rocky and mountainous terrain.
